title: How to Leave a Lasting Impression on Door People and Get Valuable Advice
caption: false

channel_info.title: Robbie Kramer
channel_info.description:
I'm Robbie Kramer 🎙Host of The Inner Confidence Podcast & Founder of Inner Confidence, Inc.

I lived an exhilarating single life filled with adventures and lessons, and ultimately achieved what I had always aspired to – finding an amazing, feminine, and loving wife. 

I believe my experiences provide a rare balance of wild freedom and committed love, equipping me with the insights to help you navigate the complexities of dating and relationships in today's world. Let me guide you to embrace your desires, improve your social prowess, and ultimately attract the partner who aligns with your highest aspirations.

You won’t find any fluffy, new-age, or cringy stuff here, just tested, proven and actionable advice that yields results.

Apply to join our exclusive Inner Confidence Community of ambitious men who are actively working together to achieve their goals faster   ► https://innerconfidence.com/community

You can email me at robbie@innerconfidence.com with any questions or comments.

transcription: {"text": "I think one thing I want to work on refining is like this art or the skill of kind of working with door people building that really because like, it's one thing to kind of know their name and exchange a few back and forth or whatever. But I think it's another thing to, I guess, one, make an impression and to kind of extract the right sort of information and the right sort of way. So that's one thing. Well, anytime you ask people for advice, they people love to give advice, right? Because they get to feel smart and savvy and all those things. And then you give them money afterwards, which they're not expecting that they're going to really love that, too. The other thing I like to do with door guys, depending on the situation, is like, I'll ask them what they like to drink and I'll bring them a drink. And even though they might not be able to drink it, like on the street, I'll like, Hey, I left your drink like right there. Right. And I'll buy him. I'll buy him drinks. And they they fucking love that.
